title: Cave City man injured in shooting
content:
A Cave City manwas hospitalized Wednesday night with a gunshot wound following an incident in Hart County, according to a news release from Kentucky State Police Post 3 in Bowling Green.
State police responded to a report of a shooting at about 7:45 p.m. Wednesday at 507 N. Jackson Highway in Hardyville. Christopher Holder, 57, was transported to Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Nashville with an apparent gunshot wound to the chest. As of late Wednesday, he was listed in critical but stable condition, according to KSP.
No other details about the incident, which is being investigated by Detective Jeremy Hodges, were immediately released.
